articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kroger (KR.N) reported a quarterly net loss on Friday as the U.S. retailer took a $1.4 billion charge related to a nationwide opioid settlement, sending its shares down as much as 3% in premarket trading.
articles.title: Kroger settles opioid case, posts net loss on related charge

articles.author: Kevin Yao, Joe Cash
articles.description: China's consumer prices in August returned to positive territory while factory-gate price declines slowed, data showed on Saturday, as deflation pressures ease amid signs of stabilisation in the economy.
articles.title: China's August consumer prices edge higher, factory price falls moderate

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain said on Friday the union representing 146,000 workers wants a deal to avoid walkouts at the Detroit Three automakers but expects to go on strike against all of them next week if they do not improve their contract offers.
articles.title: Auto workers reject Detroit Three contract offers, ready to strike

articles.author: Peter Thal Larsen
articles.description: For the past 15 years, the iPhone has been a totem of U.S. economic power. The global popularity of Apple’s (AAPL.O) ubiquitous smartphone serves as a worldwide reminder of Silicon Valley’s ingenuity and technological expertise. Yet in some eyes it now appears to have become a threat. China recently told staff at central government agencies to stop using the devices at work, Reuters reported on Thursday, and the ban could spread to regional authorities too.
articles.title: American economic power is potent but unstable

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A surging stock market powered U.S. household wealth to a record high of more than $154 trillion in the second quarter, aided by a rebound in property values, Federal Reserve data out on Friday showed.
articles.title: Stock market drives U.S. households to record wealth

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Elon Musk's X Corp sued California on Friday, challenging the constitutionality of a state law establishing new transparency requirements for social media companies, including how they police disinformation, hate speech and extremism.
articles.title: Elon Musk's X Corp sues California to undo content moderation law

articles.author: Ahmed Eljechtimi
articles.description: A powerful earthquake struck Morocco's High Atlas mountains late on Friday, killing at least 296 people, destroying buildings and sending residents of major cities rushing from their homes.
articles.title: Powerful earthquake kills 'at least' 296 in Morocco, govt says

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Charges against Donald Trump’s onetime chief of staff Mark Meadows over efforts to reverse the results of the 2020 presidential election will not be heard in federal court, a sign that similar bids by the former U.S. president and his co-defendants to move the criminal case to a more favorable venue will fail.
articles.title: Mark Meadows fails in bid to move Georgia election case to federal court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk said he refused a Ukrainian request to activate his Starlink satellite network in Crimea's port city of Sevastopol last year to aid an attack on Russia's fleet there, saying he feared complicity in a "major" act of war.
articles.title: Musk says he refused Kyiv request for Starlink use in attack on Russia
